qas.question: What has been discussed since the Federal Republic was founded in 1949?

answers.text: new delimitation of the federal territory

qas.question: What have experts advocated in regards to delimitation?

answers.text: a reduction of the number of states

qas.question: What is propagated by the richer states as a means to avoid or reduce fiscal transfers?
Since when has the delimitation of state territories been discussed?
Who advocated an increase in the number of states?
Which public discussions had far-reaching appeal?

plausible_answers.text: to avoid or reduce fiscal transfers

qas.question: Why do poorer states propagate territorial reform?
What advantage is it for richer states if territorial reform is enacted?

context: A <a0_0>new delimitation of the federal territory<a0_0/> has been discussed since the Federal Republic was founded in <b3_0>1949<b3_0/> and even before. <b4_0>Committees and expert commissions<b4_0/> advocated <a1_0>a reduction of the number of states<a1_0/>; academics (Rutz, Miegel, Ottnad etc.) and politicians (Döring, Apel, and others) made proposals –  some of them far-reaching –  for <b5_0>redrawing boundaries<b5_0/> but hardly anything came of these public discussions. <a2_0>Territorial reform<a2_0/> is sometimes propagated by the richer states as a means <b6_0>to avoid or <b7_0>reduce fiscal transfers<b7_0/><b6_0/>.
